conclusion: The car A comes in from the lower-right on a shallow NW trajectory that lines it up with the row of three red cubes lying just ahead of it.
No other blocks are in the direct line of the car; the green, orange, yellow, and blue pieces all sit farther to the left or farther up-field.
The car A will first strike the right-hand red cube almost squarely.
Because the red cubes are small and light, the car’s momentum pushes them as a group a short distance leftward.
The car, slowed but still rolling, follows immediately behind the displaced red cubes.
The shifted red cubes reach the nearest orange cube (the small single orange at the front of the orange pile) and bump it.
Almost at the same instant, the car itself noses into that same small orange cube.
The oranges are larger and heavier than the reds, so they barely move; instead, the remaining kinetic energy of the car is absorbed in this collision.
The green line, the yellow tower, and the blue arch are far enough away from the red cubes and the car.
Neither the red cubes nor the car reach the green, yellow, or blue blocks once the car’s motion is spent.
Car A comes to rest up against the front face of the lowest orange cube.
The three red cubes end up wedged between the car and the orange block, displaced a few centimeters to the left of their starting position.
A first collides with the row of red cubes, pushes them and itself leftward, and then collides with (and stops against) the nearest orange cube. It never reaches the green, yellow, or blue blocks.
